tags.name: Members
tags.description: APIs to Manage memberships for the Group Entitlements

tags.name: User Entitlement Summary
tags.description: APIs to get User Entitlements Summary.

post.description: Create a group entitlement with license rule, extension rule.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: GroupEntitlement object specifying License Rule, Extensions Rule for the group. Based on the rules the members of the group will be given licenses and extensions. The Group Entitlement can be used to add the group to another project level groups

parameters.name: ruleOption
parameters.description: RuleOption [ApplyGroupRule/TestApplyGroupRule] - specifies if the rules defined in group entitlement should be created and applied to it’s members (default option) or just be tested

get.description: Get the group entitlements for an account.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: ID of the group to delete.

parameters.name: ruleOption
parameters.description: RuleOption [ApplyGroupRule/TestApplyGroupRule] - specifies if the rules defined in group entitlement should be deleted and the changes are applied to it’s members (default option) or just be tested

parameters.name: removeGroupMembership
parameters.description: Optional parameter that specifies whether the group with the given ID should be removed from all other groups

get.description:
Get a group entitlement.

If the group entitlement does not exist, returns null.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: ID of the group.

patch.description: Update entitlements (License Rule, Extensions Rule, Project memberships etc.) for a group.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JsonPatchDocument containing the operations to perform on the group.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: ID of the group.

parameters.name: ruleOption
parameters.description: RuleOption [ApplyGroupRule/TestApplyGroupRule] - specifies if the rules defined in group entitlement should be updated and the changes are applied to it’s members (default option) or just be tested

get.description: Get direct members of a Group.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Id of the Group.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to retrieve.

parameters.name: pagingToken
parameters.description: Paging Token from the previous page fetched. If the 'pagingToken' is null, the results would be fetched from the begining of the Members List.

put.description: Add a member to a Group.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Id of the Group.

parameters.name: memberId
parameters.description: Id of the member to add.

delete.description: Remove a member from a Group.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Id of the group.

parameters.name: memberId
parameters.description: Id of the member to remove.

post.description: Add a user, assign license and extensions and make them a member of a project group in an account.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: UserEntitlement object specifying License, Extensions and Project/Team groups the user should be added to.

get.description: Get a paged set of user entitlements matching the filter criteria. If no filter is is passed, a page from all the account users is returned.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Maximum number of the user entitlements to return. Max value is 10000. Default value is 100

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Offset: Number of records to skip. Default value is 0

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Comma (",") separated list of properties and their values to filter on. Currently, the API only supports filtering by ExtensionId. An example parameter would be filter=extensionId eq search.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: Comma (",") separated list of properties to select in the result entitlements. names of the properties are - 'Projects, 'Extensions' and 'Grouprules'.

patch.description: Edit the entitlements (License, Extensions, Projects, Teams etc) for one or more users.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JsonPatchDocument containing the operations to perform.

parameters.name: doNotSendInviteForNewUsers
parameters.description: Whether to send email invites to new users or not

delete.description:
Delete a user from the account.

The delete operation includes unassigning Extensions and Licenses and removing the user from all project memberships.
The user would continue to have access to the account if she is member of an AAD group, that is added directly to the account.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of the user.

get.description: Get User Entitlement for a user.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of the user.

patch.description: Edit the entitlements (License, Extensions, Projects, Teams etc) for a user.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JsonPatchDocument containing the operations to perform on the user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of the user.

get.description: Get summary of Licenses, Extension, Projects, Groups and their assignments in the collection.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: Comma (",") separated list of properties to select. Supported property names are {AccessLevels, Licenses, Extensions, Projects, Groups}.

accountLicenseType.description: Type of Account License (e.g. Express, Stakeholder etc.)

assignmentSource.description: Assignment Source of the License (e.g. Group, Unknown etc.

msdnLicenseType.description: Type of MSDN License (e.g. Visual Studio Professional, Visual Studio Enterprise etc.)

values.description: User has signed in at least once to the VSTS account
User cannot sign in; primarily used by admin to temporarily remove a user due to absence or license reallocation
User is removed from the VSTS account by the VSTS account admin
User is invited to join the VSTS account by the VSTS account admin, but has not signed up/signed in yet
User can sign in; primarily used when license is in expired state and we give a grace period
User is disabled; if reenabled, they will still be in the Pending state

errors.description: List of error codes paired with their corresponding error messages

assignmentSource.description: Assignment source for this extension. I.e. explicitly assigned or from a group rule.

source.description: Source of this extension assignment. Ex: msdn, account, none, etc.

assignedThroughSubscription.description: Count of Extension Licenses assigned to users through msdn.

minimumLicenseRequired.description: Minimum License Required for the Extension.

values.description: No service rights. The user cannot access the account
Default or minimum service level
Premium service level - either by purchasing on the Azure portal or by purchasing the appropriate MSDN subscription
Only available to a specific set of MSDN Subscribers
Stakeholder service level

remainingTrialDays.description: Days remaining for the Trial to expire.

trialExpiryDate.description: Date on which the Trial expires.

description.description: A short phrase to help human readers disambiguate groups with similar names

cuid.description: The Consistently Unique Identifier of the subject

domain.description: This represents the name of the container of origin for a graph member. (For MSA this is "Windows Live ID", for AD the name of the domain, for AAD the tenantID of the directory, for VSTS groups the ScopeId, etc)

mailAddress.description: The email address of record for a given graph member. This may be different than the principal name.

principalName.description: This is the PrincipalName of this graph member from the source provider. The source provider may change this field over time and it is not guaranteed to be immutable for the life of the graph member by VSTS.

legacyDescriptor.description: [Internal Use Only] The legacy descriptor is here in case you need to access old version IMS using identity descriptor.

origin.description: The type of source provider for the origin identifier (ex:AD, AAD, MSA)

originId.description: The unique identifier from the system of origin. Typically a sid, object id or Guid. Linking and unlinking operations can cause this value to change for a user because the user is not backed by a different provider and has a different unique id in the new provider.

subjectKind.description: This field identifies the type of the graph subject (ex: Group, Scope, User).

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

metaType.description: The meta type of the user in the origin, such as "member", "guest", etc. See UserMetaType for the set of possible values.

id.description: The unique identifier which matches the Id of the GraphMember.

lastExecuted.description: [Readonly] The last time the group licensing rule was executed (regardless of whether any changes were made).

members.description: Group members. Only used when creating a new group.

projectEntitlements.description: Relation between a project and the member's effective permissions in that project.

status.description: The status of the group rule.

values.description: Rule is created or updated, but apply is pending
Rule is applied
The group rule was incompatible
Rule failed to apply unexpectedly and should be retried

completed.description: Operation completed with success or failure.

haveResultsSucceeded.description: True if all operations were successful.

results.description: List of results for each operation.

groupId.description: Identifier of the Group being acted upon

result.description: Result of the Groupentitlement after the operation

JsonPatchDocument.description: The JSON model for JSON Patch Operations

JsonPatchOperation.description: The JSON model for a JSON Patch operation

from.description: The path to copy from for the Move/Copy operation.

value.description: The value for the operation. This is either a primitive or a JToken.

isPurchasable.description: Designates if this license quantity can be changed through purchase

nextBillingDate.description: Specifies the date when billing will charge for paid licenses

totalAfterNextBillingDate.description: Total license count after next billing cycle

completed.description: Operation completed with success or failure

haveResultsSucceeded.description: True if all operations were successful

results.description: List of results for each operation

operationResults.description: List of results for each operation

isSuccess.description: True if all operations were successful.

memberEntitlement.description: Result of the member entitlement after the operations. have been applied

status.description: The current status of the operation.

values.description: The operation does not have a status set.
The operation has been queued.
The operation is in progress.
The operation was cancelled by the user.
The operation completed successfully.
The operation completed with a failure.

url.description: URL to get the full operation object.

errors.description: List of error codes paired with their corresponding error messages.

memberId.description: Identifier of the Member being acted upon.

result.description: Result of the MemberEntitlement after the operation.

isProjectPermissionInherited.description: Whether the user is inheriting permissions to a project through a VSTS or AAD group membership.

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

accessLevel.description: User's access level denoted by a license.

groupAssignments.description: [Readonly] GroupEntitlements that this user belongs to.

id.description: The unique identifier which matches the Id of the Identity associated with the GraphMember.

lastAccessedDate.description: [Readonly] Date the user last accessed the collection.

projectEntitlements.description: Relation between a project and the user's effective permissions in that project.

completed.description: Operation completed with success or failure.

haveResultsSucceeded.description: True if all operations were successful.

results.description: List of results for each operation.

errors.description: List of error codes paired with their corresponding error messages.

result.description: Result of the MemberEntitlement after the operation.

userId.description: Identifier of the Member being acted upon.

operationResults.description: List of results for each operation.

isSuccess.description: True if all operations were successful.

userEntitlement.description: Result of the user entitlement after the operations have been applied.

extensions.description: Summary of Extensions in the account.

licenses.description: Summary of Licenses in the Account.

projectRefs.description: Summary of Projects in the Account.

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialized collections as a single JSON object on the wire, to avoid serializing JSON arrays directly to the client, which can be a security hole

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '4.1-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.memberEntitlementManagement: Grants the ability to read users, their licenses as well as projects and extensions they can access
scopes.vso.memberEntitlementManagement_write: Grants the ability to manage users, their licenses as well as projects and extensions they can access
